meanings.definition: A wedge-shaped piece of wood or metal.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a cunei to secure the table leg.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith crafted a cunei to split the log.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the cunei as a tiny seesaw.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a cunei, driving a wedge between the friends.
meanings.sent5: The cunei slid effortlessly into the gap, holding the door open.

meanings.definition: A wedge-shaped character used in ancient writing systems.
meanings.sent1: The ancient scribe carefully etched the cunei onto the clay tablet.
meanings.sent2: The historian studied the cunei inscriptions to decipher the message.
meanings.sent3: The playful child pretended the cunei was a tiny boat sailing on the paper.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were like sharp cuneis, leaving a lasting impression on the audience.
meanings.sent5: The cunei symbolized power and authority in the ancient script.

meanings.definition: A wedge-shaped bone in the foot.
meanings.sent1: The doctor pointed to the cunei in the foot X-ray.
meanings.sent2: Athletes often experience pain in the cunei due to stress fractures.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy dancer tripped over her own cunei bone.
meanings.sent4: The cunei bone supported the arch of the foot like a tiny pillar.
meanings.sent5: He felt a sharp pain in his cunei when he landed awkwardly.
